column5: Thats a pretty cool thing she went and did for ya. I like that.

As an individual that struggles to get paint to canvas I must really disagree as to the quality of the painting. Some have refereed to it as pretty slick, pretty cool, pretty neat, really neat, life like, etc. etc.  I would say the recreation of the moment captured in the photograph could only be described as a both brilliant an successful journey that the artist made. She should be very proud of her work and I must say it does remind me of a world renowned artist from Burlington Ontario. He is now known for his work of natural settings of wildlife. In his earlier works his lifelike realism took us into the world of sports. One being his portrait of a young Ken Dryden. He is Robert Bateman. This artist work is worthy of an early Bateman. Hold onto it my friend like it is a bar of gold.

My Dad does a lot of paintings (actually painted with Robert Bateman years ago) and I can see that this is a great painting! I'd put that on my wall in a heartbeat! Congrats, and great decision to commission Lew for a photo! haha.

As an individual that struggles to get paint to canvas I must really disagree as to the quality of the painting. Some have refereed to it as pretty slick, pretty cool, pretty neat, really neat, life like, etc. etc.  I would say the recreation of the moment captured in the photograph could only be described as a both brilliant an successful journey that the artist made. She should be very proud of her work and I must say it does remind me of a world renowned artist from Burlington Ontario. He is now known for his work of natural settings of wildlife. In his earlier works his lifelike realism took us into the world of sports. One being his portrait of a young Ken Dryden. He is Robert Bateman. This artist work is worthy of an early Bateman. Hold onto it my friend like it is a bar of gold.  Wow, I will certainly pass this along to her,  along with this whole thread.  As I mentioned before, I'm very pleased with it and will certainly have it for as long as I live.
Really nice painting Jim.

Hi all.  Just over a month ago while I was up at Nipissing, I met up with Lew on the water and he snapped this picture of me. I was really pleased with the way it turned out and since i didnt have any other pictures like it I decided to have a lady I work with paint it for me. I'm really pleased with the way it turned out and thought some might enjoy it.  Jim

I was really pleased with the way it turned out and since i didnt have any other pictures like it I decided to have a lady I work with paint it for me. I'm really pleased with the way it turned out and thought some might enjoy it.  Jim
That's some great work love the details on the painting.
wow !!! that looks great !!  ! nice of lew to snap that pic,and awesome that your co-worker painted that  !!! cool
It's excellent Jim and your friend has some real talent.  We'll talk about my commission later on
Wow, that's a great job on the painting!
Awesome painting Jim.
It was hard to tell the difference at first. She did a great job.
Beautifully done! Your co-worker is super talented.
nice work   looks  great
Very nice Jim... but you realize you're gonna lose the end of your Johnson when you frame it!
lol   nice painting
That's awesome. I think I need to do something like that fro my brother.
I'm sure his will fit in the frame.
Pretty sweet!
That is very nice.Well done!!
Wow.  Thanks for the replies guys.  Lew we'll discuss your commission : ).  Wayne, the painting is on a canvas so I think my johnson will still  be showing.  ; )
Cool. Nice work.
Very nice Jim, really great work there!

Wow that is an amazing painting your co worker is very talented everything is more detailed in the painting than the actual photo I am sure you will enjoy it for many years to come.

Cheers Mitch...
That is very wel done painting!  It seems way more vivid than photo even  Great stuff!
Very nice painting.  I'm impressed!
really cool...
Very cool picture!
That's pretty slick Jim.  Nice to have done.
